properties.description: Posted by Horst

properties.name: Akagera National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Rwanda\'s share of wildlife is thinner than at game parks just across the border in Tanzania, but the savanna of Akagera National Park is home to giraffes, hippos, crocodiles, antelope, and elephants." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Altes Museum
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "The Old Museum, one of the first purpose- built museums to house a royal collection, was designed in 1823 by Karl Friedrich Schinkel. The façade\'s peristyle of 18 Ionic columns, inspired by the Stoa of Attalos, in Athens, demonstrates Schinkel\'s interest in ancient architecture and epitomizes Neoclassical style and 19th-century museum design." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: B. Johnstone
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 4 N. Main St., Kent, CTA winsome boutique run by Bartley Inge Johnstone, an effervescent interior designer who handpicks her collection of clothing and new and vintage housewares

properties.name: Barcelona Pavillion
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"The Barcelona chair, an icon of 20th-century design, was born in a sleek, equally iconic masterpiece of Modernism in Montjuïc Park: the German National Pavilion at the 1929 Barcelona International Exhibition. Mies van der Rohe designed both, and the pavilion\'s space—enclosed by walls of glass, travertine, green marble, and golden onyx—embodies his concept of open- plan, while its colors and materials define the period\'s ideal of elegance." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Blue and John Crow Mountains National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  The backwoods of the cockpit country features rare birds, steep mountains, waterfalls and ganja.

properties.name: Bwindi Impenetrable National Park
properties.description: Posted by System    Located in south-western Uganda, at the junction of the plain and mountain forests, Bwindi Park covers 32,000 ha and is known for its exceptional biodiversity, with more than 160 species of trees and over 100 species of ferns. Many types of birds and butterflies can also be found there, as well as many endangered species, including the mountain gorilla.

properties.name: Bwindi Impenetrable National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Bwindi Impenetrable National Park, one of the wildest places on earth, is in the mountainous, volcanic borderlands near the Congo and Rwanda. Here, about half of the world\'s 650 mountain gorillas roam under the protection of armed rangers. None of Uganda\'s thrills—and there are many—tops hiking the steep, nettled slopes of the Bwindi Impenetrable Forest to spend an hour just feet from adorable juvenile gorillas or a seriously intimidating silverback."Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Casa de las Artesanias
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus    "Casa de las Artesanías, or House of the Handicrafts (52-443-312-1248), is a two-story museum shop in the former Convent of San Francisco where you can see (and buy) pottery, textiles, brass pots, gold and silver jewelry, guitars and other stringed instruments made by Purépecha Indians Open daily; free. " NYT 9/16/06

properties.name: Castello di Amorosa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Fourth-generation winemaker Daryl Sattui spent the past 14 years building Castello di Amorosa (4045 N. St. Helena Hwy.; 707/286-7212), a 121,000-square-foot medieval-style castle, constructed from hand-carved chestnut beams, basalt, sandstone, and 200-year-old brick. He was nothing if not thorough: among the 107 rooms are a church, stables, and a dungeon, complete with torture devices. (The entire project cost 7 million.) Says Sattui, a self-proclaimed "madman" with an affinity for pocket squares, "I just wanted to build out all of my ideas." Thus, 100 of those rooms are of no use to the public. Politicians and San Francisco socialites—George Pataki, Dede Wilsey—have hosted events in the frescoed Great Hall. Beginning this month, visitors can taste Castello wines (Merlot, Pinot Grigio) in the underground cellar and then take a 45-minute castle tour. For a couple of hours, you’ll forget you’re in Napa—and the 21st century." Travel & Liesure April 2007

properties.name: Catedral
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"The Catedral, built from 1660 to 1744, towers over the city center. Many ornate details have been added over the centuries, including an 18th-century silver neo-Classical baptismal font and a 20th-century pipe organ" NYT 9/16/06

properties.name: Chichen Itza
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Chichen Itza"The tropical lowlands of the Yucatán Peninsula and northern Central America are dotted with Mayan and Toltec ruins. Few are as grand as Chichén Itzá. The site\'s pyramids, ball courts, and palaces, grouped around grand plazas, leave no doubt of the sophisticated civilization that thrived centuries before Columbus arrived." T & L Sept 2006

properties.name: Coit Tower
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"The most distinctive structure on the skyline. Inside the tower, 19 Depression-era murals depict economic and political life in California. The government commissioned the murals, and the 25 artists who painted them were each paid 8 a week. You can ride the elevator to the top of the tower to enjoy the view of the Bay Bridge and the Golden Gate Bridge. The views from the base of the tower are also expansive---and free. " Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Conservatory of Flowers
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  Golden Gate Park"Many first-time visitors gasp in awe when they see this gorgeous, white-framed glass structure, and locals will tell you that its effect isn\'t much dimmed over time. Built in the late 1870s, the oldest building in the park is the last remaining wood-frame Victorian conservatory in the country. It\'s also a copy of the conservatory in the Royal Botanical Gardens in Kew, England" Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: David Livingstone Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "History buffs interested in David Livingstone\'s missionary journey should visit the village of Chitambo, near Kasanka National Park, where he died and where his heart is buried beneath a tree."

properties.name: Double Bluff Beach
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus   double bluff road, langley, WAAn off leash beach beneath a long cliff, wondrous pools and sandbars at low tide and views back to Seattle, Mt. Rainier and the Olympics

properties.name: Ellesmere Island
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  ellemere island, canada"Ellesmere is a vast desert island-the 10h largestin the world,not a tropical paradise but an icy wilderness at the top of the world, aplace of undulating ice fields, rugged gray black mountains and boulder strewn glaciers." 1001 natural wonders

properties.name: Etosha National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Etosha National Park\'s scruffy savanna lacks knockout scenery, but within minutes of driving into the park (visits are self-guided), you have a good chance of spotting nearly all of Africa\'s iconic big game " Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Fallingwater
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"In 1991, the American Institute of Architects voted this 1939 house "the best all-time work of American architecture." Frank Lloyd Wright built it atop a rocky outcropping and extended the floors to reflect the ledges around it, redefining how architecture could be integrated with nature. The showstopper: a terrace daringly cantilevered over a rushing waterfall." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Ferry Building
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Renovated in 2003, the Ferry Building is the jewel of the Embarcadero. The beacon of the port area, erected in 1896, has a 230-foot clock tower modeled after the campanile of the cathedral in Seville, Spain. On the morning of April 18, 1906, the four great clock faces on the tower, powered by the swinging of a 14-foot pendulum, stopped at 5:17 -- the moment the great earthquake struck -- and stayed still for 12 months. Today San Franciscans flock to the street-level gourmet Market Hall, stocking up on supplies from local favorites such as Acme Bread, Scharffen Ber Chocolate, and Cowgirl Creamery" Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Golden Haven Hot Springs
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1713 Lake St., Calistoga,CA"The classic Calistoga mud-bath experience—sinking into an aromatic mass of muck heated to 105 degrees—is not for the prim. This town has more kitschy mud emporiums than one would care to count, let alone visit. But among the long-standing lot, the private Golden Haven Hot Springs (1713 Lake St.; 707/942-8000; treatments from 9) is one of the most professional and up-to-date"T&L 4/07

properties.name: Guggenheim Museum Bilbao
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Soon after it opened in 1997, critics hailed the dynamic, swirling titanium mass as one of the 20th century\'s great buildings. As the catalyst for the regeneration of this Basque city, the structure claims an intimate yet fluid connection with its setting: it hugs the curves of the Nervión River, its silvery "tail" emerging beneath a bridge like that of a giant metal fish." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Hagia Sophia
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusistanbul"The dome atop Constantinople\'s Church of Divine Wisdom, erected in 532 A.D., was the largest in the world until St. Peter\'s was completed 1,000 years later. In 1453, the conquering Ottomans turned the Byzantine church into a mosque, adding minarets and plastering over its elaborate mosaics. This confluence of cultures is now a museum—with its mosaics resplendently restored" T & L Sept 2006

properties.name: Hong Kong Museum of History
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "This museum is a testament to Hong Kong’s determination not just to survive (see the extraordinary film scenes of typhoons, the Japanese occupation and Red Guard campaigns), but also to prosper (behold a replica of an old street lined with a pawn shop, tea house, post office, bank, grocery store and Chinese pharmacy)" NYT 4/5/07

properties.name: Ivindo National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Ivindo National Park is the site of Langoué Bai, an isolated clearing remarkable for its large concentration of elephants and gorillas. Also within Ivindo\'s borders are the Kongou and Mingouli waterfalls, the most impressive in Central Africa." Conde Nast June 2006

properties.name: Kafue National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "In Zambia\'s oldest and largest park, Kafue, the best game viewing is on the Busanga Plains, which support roan and sable antelopes, elephants, lions, and cheetahs. " Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: La Ruta Moskitia
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Said one guest of this locally owned tour collective in the Río Plátano Biosphere Reserve, "The trip was a great opportunity to see such an untouched spot, but it caps it off to know that our money is going to the right places." Seven communities run the excursions: Kayak through a pine savanna under monkeys and toucans, watch Garifuna dancing, go nighttime crocodile spotting, volunteer with a sea turtle project, and see ancient petroglyphs while guided by likely descendants of the carvers. In addition to what they charge travelers, members of the collective earn bonuses for improving the palm-thatched guest cabanas and other parts of the tourism infrastructure. Ten percent of profits also goes to conservation and community development (504-443-1276; larutamoskitia.com; eight days, 10–95 per person." Conde Nast Sept 2006

properties.name: Lavender Hill Spa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1015 Foothill Blvd., Calistoga, CA

properties.name: Likoma Island
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Likoma Island, accessible by public ferry just once a week (or by chartered boat or plane), is well worth a visit to see Chipyela, a quaint town with cobbled roads and a stone church, built by Anglican missionaries in 1906, that is nearly as large as Westminster Cathedral. " Conde Nast June 2006

properties.name: Liwonde National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Liwonde National Park teems with hippos, crocodiles, and elephants." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Loango National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "At dusk each night, a procession of elephants, buffalo, and even the occasional hippo emerges on "Petit Loango Beach, a 60-mile stretch of white sand in Loango National Park. The park is one of the few places in the world where you can observe these and other big beasts—including chimpanzees and humpback whales—in such close proximity" Conde Nast June 2006

properties.name: Lombard Street
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"The block-long "Crookedest Street in the World" makes eight switchbacks down the east face of Russian Hill between Hyde and Leavenworth streets. You take in super views of North Beach and Coit Tower whether you walk or drive---though if you\'re the one behind the wheel, you\'d better keep your eye on the road lest you become yet another of the many folks who ram the garden barriers" Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Lope National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Lopé National Park, reached by a four-hour train ride from Libreville, is known for its gorillas, troops of rare and brilliantly colored mandrill monkeys, and 400 bird species. The neighboring Offoué River can be explored in traditional dugout canoes. Fans of Albert Schweitzer will want to visit the small riverside town of Lambaréné to see the hospital he built and a museum dedicated to his work." Conde Nast June 2006

properties.name: Lower Zambezi National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "With its thick woodlands and gentle waterways, the Lower Zambezi National Parkis best seen by boat or, better still, by canoe." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Lyme Regis Ltd
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 43 N Main St, Kent, CT"the owner of Lyme Regis, Ltd. (43 N. Main St.; 860/927-3330), makes twice-yearly visits to England to select her quirky assortment of oddities, from figural inkwells and snuffboxes to vintage valentines." Travel & Liesure April 2007

properties.name: Man Ho Temple
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Hong Kong Island\'s oldest and most important temple was built in the 1840s and is named after its two principal deities: Man, the god of literature, who is dressed in red and holds a calligraphy brush; and Mo, the god of war, wearing a green robe and holding a sword. Ironically, Mo finds patronage in both the police force (shrines in his honor can be found in all Hong Kong police stations today) and the infamous triad secret societies. Two ornately carved sedan chairs in the temple were once used during festivals to carry the statues of the gods around the neighborhood. But what makes the temple particularly memorable are the giant incense coils hanging from the ceiling, imparting a fragrant, smoky haze--these are purchased by patrons seeking fulfillment of their wishes, such as good health or a successful business deal, and may burn as long as 3 weeks." Frommer\'s

properties.name: Millenium Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus   "Mayor Richard M. Daley’s sensory-overloading masterpiece along Lake Michigan. The park, which opened in 2004, a tad late for the start of the millennium (and vastly over budget), is still worth seeing. Stop at the band shell, blossoming with giant ribbons of stainless steel, designed by Frank Gehry, and stand beneath the silver “Bean” sculpture (the artist, Anish Kapoor, prefers its real name, “Cloud Gate”) to see your own reflection against the city’s skyline." NYT 09/15/06

properties.name: Murchison Falls National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "In the center of the country is Murchison Falls National Park, historically Uganda\'s star attraction, where the Nile funnels through a rift valley in dramatic cascades, attracting elephants, lions, giraffes, and buffalo. Unfortunately, both the U.S. State Department and Britain\'s Foreign & Commonwealth Office currently advise travelers to avoid the area because of increased rebel activity and sporadic attacks on tourists." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Museum of Contemporary Art
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  220 East Chicago Ave Chicago Il"In the blur of sales and shopping bags, the Museum of Contemporary Art (220 East Chicago Avenue, 312-280-2660; www.mcachicago.org) makes the Magnificent Mile worth seeing, even for those who hate to shop." NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: Namib-Naukluft National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "The world\'s oldest desert, the Namib, meets the icy Atlantic in Namib-Naukluft National Park. Explore by foot, hot-air balloon, quad-bike, even surfboard (to ride the dunes, not waves). Nearby Swakopmund is a lively seaside resort, but for a dose of desert solitude, stay in one of the park\'s excellent lodges or camps " Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Ngamba Island
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusNgamba is where Jane Goodall established a reserve for orphaned chimpanzees

properties.name: Nyungwe Forest
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "chimpanzees, Angola colobus monkeys, and golden monkeys—are plentiful in Nyungwe Forest" Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Oriental Institute
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  1155 East 58th Street, Chicago, IL"Wander the Oriental Institute (1155 East 58th Street, 773-702-9514; www.oi.uchicago.edu) for its collection of objects from the ancient Middle East. " NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: Palace of Fine Arts
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "At first glance this stunning, rosy rococo palace seems to be from another world, and indeed, it\'s the sole survivor of the many tinted-plaster structures built for the 1915 Panama-Pacific International Exposition. The expo lasted for 288 days, and the buildings extended about a mile along the shore. Bernard Maybeck designed this faux Roman Classic beauty, which was reconstructed in concrete and reopened in 1967. The massive columns, great rotunda (dedicated to the glory of Greek culture), and swan-filled lagoon have been used in countless fashion layouts and films" Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Pantheon
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"This monumental temple, in use throughout its history, was erected by the Roman consul Marcus Agrippa in 27 B.C., rebuilt by Hadrian after a fire in about 125 A.D., and consecrated as a Christian church in 609 A.D. It stands as a pure expression of classical proportions; the coffered dome—with a heaven-gazing oculus at its apex—and colonnaded portico have inspired generations of architects." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Parc National Des Volcans
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Most of Rwanda\'s tourists come for a glimpse of the mountain gorillas that populate the jungles of the Parc National des Volcans, in the country\'s northwest. All of the estimated 650 mountain gorillas living in the wild are in this region, a habitat shared by Rwanda, Uganda, and the Congo. Thanks in large part to the heroic conservation efforts of American primatologist Dian Fossey—whose life and mysterious death were the basis for the 1988 film Gorillas in the Mist—the gorilla population has stabilized and even increased. Their survival is especially remarkable considering the prolonged periods of regional instability when monitoring and anti-poaching activities were suspended. For diehard Fossey fans, a side trip to her grave can be arranged during a gorilla trek" Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Po Lin Monastary
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"This monastery on the 1,700-foot-high Ngong Ping plateau, features a 112-foot-high statue of a seated Buddha, made of bronze sheets over a steel frame. Admission to the 101-year-old monastery is free, but to climb up to the Buddha, visitors are encouraged to buy a coupon for a vegetarian meal in a nearby pavilion" NYT

properties.name: R.T. Facts
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 22. S. Main St., Kent, CT"The boldest antiques are found at R. T. Facts (22 S. Main St.; 860/927-1700) where owners Natalie and Greg Randall stock muscular griffins, statuary, and lanterns, for the home and garden." Travel & Liesure April 2007

properties.name: Rwanda National Museum
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "In Butare, the National Museum—arguably the best in East Africa—provides an excellent background on the country\'s complicated history and culture (several exhibits are explained in French only)." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Ryoanji Temple
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"The former Imperial capital is filled with temples and gardens, but late-15th-century Ryoanji ("Temple of the Peaceful Dragon") stands out for its stark simplicity. Its walled-in courtyard contains nothing more than 15 large mossy rocks surrounded by a sea of raked gravel, the quintessential Zen garden." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Salt River Bay
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  virgin islands"Views of the sea, mangroves, and the site of a tiny village where Columbus and his sailors fought the Carib Indians" NYT 10/31/04

properties.name: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  151 Third Street San Francisco, CA 94103"Mario Botta designed the striking SFMOMA facility, completed in early 1995, which consists of a sienna brick facade and a central tower of alternating bands of black and white stone. Inside, natural light from the tower floods the central atrium and some of the museum\'s galleries. A black-and-gray stone staircase leads from the atrium to four floors of galleries. Works by Henri Matisse, Pablo Picasso, Georgia O\'Keeffe, Frida Kahlo, Jackson Pollock, and Andy Warhol form the heart of the diverse permanent collection, which art enthusiasts claim isn\'t the world-class collection it should be." Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Shanghai Tang
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "You are stepping back into the Shanghai of the 1930s when you enter this small but upscale two-level store with its gleaming wooden and tiled floors, raised cashier cubicles, ceiling fans, and helpful clerks wearing classical Chinese jackets. This is Chinese chic at its best, with neatly stacked rows of updated versions of traditional Chinese clothing, ranging from cheongsams and silk pajamas to padded jackets, caps, and shoes -- all in bright, contemporary colors and styles. If you\'re looking for a lime-green or shocking pink padded jacket, this is the place for you. " Frommers

properties.name: Sir John Soane's Museum
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Architect John Soane, designer of the Bank of England and the Dulwich Picture Gallery, rebuilt three adjacent town houses from 1792 to 1823 and filled them with his treasures—an Egyptian sarcophagus, Roman marbles, Hogarth\'s The Rake\'s Progress. Displayed chockablock, they now form part of a connoisseur\'s legacy in a museum that retains the character of a private house while its clever design accommodates a collector\'s zeal." T & L September 2006

properties.name: Skeleton Coast Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "This foggy, 300-mile coastline bordering a savage desert earned its scary sobriquet from the whale bones and shipwreck debris that littered its beaches; its forbidding conditions continue to deter all but a colony of hardy seals." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Sloane-Stanley Museum
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  31 Kent-Cornwall Road, Kent, CT"The nucleus of this museum is local artist, author and illustrator Eric Sloane’s (1905-85) extensive collection of Early American and pre-Industrial Era tools. Open May-Oct." T&L April 2007

properties.name: South Luangwa National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "South Luangwa National Park has a number of excellent lodges and camps and is the most accessible of the four parks in the wildlife-rich Luangwa River Valley. It\'s best known for its walking safaris—rare in Africa—in which visitors explore by foot or even trek from one camp to the next." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Stanley
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"At the end of the line, in Stanley Market, you\'ll find an easy-to-navigate warren of shops, many offering what appear to be the same pashmina scarves, silk ties and paintings of Hong Kong\'s harbor. But a closer look will reveal great shopping: the stores on Old Stanley Street for childrens\' clothes, Tong\'s for table linens (55-57 Stanley Street; 852-2813-0337) and Sun & Moon for sportswear (18 A-B, Stanley Main Street; 852-2813-2723). Don\'t miss two of the nonshopping sights in Stanley: the Murray Building, a colonial treasure that was dismantled on the other side of the island and rebuilt here in 2000, and the Tin Hau temple, built in 1767 and dedicated to the deity who protects seafarers." NYT 4/6/07

properties.name: Star Ferry
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"This ferry has been a Hong Kong fixture for so long that many assumed it would remain an immutable feature of local life. They were wrong. Its famous downtown terminal was demolished in 2006, mainly to make way for a highway. The new terminal, across the street from Hong Kong’s tallest building, Two International Financial Center, is at the tip of a landfill that sticks out like a long peninsula toward Kowloon, shortening the ferry’s route. The trip across the harbor takes just five minutes now and is less entertaining. Much better are the round-the-harbor tours. The Star Ferry has outfitted one of its beautiful wood-decked vessels with armchairs instead of benches and added a small snack kiosk. The Shining Star sails once an hour around the harbor, stopping in Central and Wan Chai on the Hong Kong island side and in Tsim Sha Tsui on the Kowloon side; there are also stops in Hung Hom, an unprepossessing area of Kowloon, during daylight sailings." NYT 4/5/07

properties.name: Taj Mahal
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Emperor Shah Jahan, in 1632, commissioned this most famous of all mausoleums for his favorite wife, Mumtaz. One of the greatest examples of Moghul architecture—a marriage of Hindu, Persian, and Islamic design—the Taj sits amid serene pools that reflect its unmistakable profile." T & L Sept 2006

properties.name: The Green at Grant Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  352 East Monroe Street, Chicago, IL"slip away from the crowds to the unlikely and often overlooked Grant Park miniature golf course, the Green at Grant Park (352 East Monroe Street, 312-642-7888), which seems to be camouflaged in the sea of green around here. Adults can play 18 holes (par 42) f"or , and children for ." NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: The Peak Tram
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Hong Kong’s most popular tourist attraction is this pair trams that rumble up and down the steep hillside from downtown to a gap in the hills. Starting at a terminal across Garden Road from the United States consulate, the trams trundle between the aging apartment buildings of the Mid Levels neighborhood and then ascend a precipitous slope at angles of up to 28 degrees, emerging from among the skyscrapers and trees to lovely views of the harbor. At the top is the Peak Tower, an eight-story complex of stores and restaurants that has just been remodeled and has some of the best views in the city." NYT 4/6/07

properties.name: Vals Spa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "In a remote valley in southeastern Switzerland, the contemporary architect Peter Zumthor has elevated the ancient thermal bath to the realm of the sublime. Contrasts between light and shade, especially in otherworldly grottoes of quartzite shrouding softly lit pools, inform the experience. Incomparable Alpine views from outdoor spaces serve as a reminder that nature is the preeminent architect" T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Victoria Falls
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusDescribed by the Kololo tribe living in the area in the 1800’s as ‘Mosi-oa-Tunya’ - ‘the Smoke that Thunders’ and in more modern terms as ‘the greatest known curtain of falling water’, Victoria Falls are a spectacular sight of awe-inspiring beauty and grandeur on the Zambezi River, bordering Zambia and Zimbabwe

properties.name: Waterberg Plateau Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Waterberg Plateau Park contains more rare fauna, but to see the shiest of all, visit the research and education facility of the nearby Cheetah Conservation Fund (CCF). Guardians of Namibia\'s 2,500 cheetahs—the world\'s greatest concentration of the highly endangered species—CCF staff let visitors watch them feed and exercise captive cats and cubs; call in advance for feeding times (264-67-306-225; cheetah.org; suggested donation, )." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Windsor castle
properties.description: Posted by Edboguswindsor castleStanding at the very heart of British identity, Windsor is the oldest and largest castle in Britain and, with 1000 rooms, the largest occupied castle in the world.
